articles.title: Kim Yong Namã€€Greets Ghanaian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Ghanaian President
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greeting to John Evans Atta Mills, president of Ghana, on the 55th anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in his message noted with pleasure that the government and people of Ghana are registering big successes in consolidating the national independence and bringing about social progress.
					
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further develop, Kim wished the president greater success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Rallies of Servicepersons and People Held to Vow to Bury Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors
articles.content:
Rallies of Servicepersons and People Held to Vow to Bury Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors 
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons and people in South Phyongan and South Hamgyong Provinces held rallies on Monday to vow to wage a merciless sacred war to bury the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					 The statement of a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army was read out to be followed by speeches at those rallies.
					
					 The floor was taken by An Kuk Thae, chairman of the Provincial People's Committee, general officer Ri Hung Sop on behalf of KPA service members, Kim Kwang Son, teacher, on behalf of the Worker-Peasant Red Guards and Jon Kwang Min, vice department director of the Provincial Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, on behalf of youths and students at the rally held in South Phyongan Province.
					
					 The speakers said the service personnel of the KPA and all the people in their province were waiting for an order to wipe out the enemies, keeping themselves on high alert to bury the Lee group of traitors through a merciless all-people retaliation.
					
					 They said the Lee group is hordes of dead men who ceased to be human beings and mad dogs which are making desperate efforts before breathing their last.
					
					 They vowed to take revenge upon the enemy a thousand times to beat to death all the dregs of the society that hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and its inviolable social system. 
					
					 They called on the service personnel, all the party members and other working people, youths and students in the province to firmly protect the undisputed prestige of the great men of Mt. Paektu and devotedly safeguard the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Those who took floor at the rally held in South Hamgyong Province included Kwak Pom Gi, chief secretary of the Provincial Committee of the WPK, KPA general officer Nam Sang Ho who spoke on behalf of the KPA service members, Kong Sung Il, manager of the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex, who spoke on behalf of the Worker-Peasant Red Guards and Han In Chol, first secretary of the provincial committee of the youth league, who spoke on behalf of the youths and students.
					
					 The speakers said they would further intensify the sacred war for retaliation against the traitors' group nonstop till they force it to pay a thousand-fold dearer price for its crimes.
					
					 All the party members and other working people will stage a fierce drive to push forward production and construction and improve the standard of the people's living in such fields as light industry, agriculture, stockbreeding and fish farming in the spirit of mercilessly wiping out the  group of traitors with arms of Songun, hammers and sickles, the speakers noted.
					
					 While their speeches were made at the rallies their venues shook with angry shouts of slogans "Tear apart Lee Myung Bak in the name of the nation!" "Let Us beat the military warmongers to death" and "Let Us crush the Lee Myung Bak's group of traitors!"
					
					The rallies were followed by demonstrations.

articles.title: Youths and Students Meet to Vow to Join KPA
articles.content:
Youths and Students Meet to Vow to Join KPA 
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Youths and students met on Monday before the main sculpture Victory of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower to vow to join or rejoin the Korean People's Army for a sacred war of Korean style to wipe out the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. 
					 Seen there were slogans including "Let us defend with our very lives the Party Central Committee headed by the dear respected Comrade Kim Jong Un!" "Tear apart Lee Myung Bak to death in the name of the nation!" and "Let us make retaliation against the Lee group through our own sacred war of all the service personnel and people!" and posters. 
					
					 At the meeting Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, read out the statement issued by a spokesman for the KPA Supreme Command. 
					
					 Speeches were made by Ri Jo Il, first secretary of the Songrim City Committee of the youth league, Jong Tu Song, a student of Kim Il Sung University, Ri Myong Won, a worker of the Taedonggang Foodstuff Factory, and Pae Song Nam, a student of Pyongyang Rakwon Secondary School.
					
					 The speakers said the Lee Myung Bak group hardly called human being hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK which all the people consider as dearer than their own lives, adding they could no longer remain onlookers to this hooliganism. 
					
					 Youths and students from across the country fervently volunteer to join or rejoin the KPA, firmly determined to finish off the Lee group, the sworn enemy and human scum, and turn its bases into ashes by deadly strikes of Songun, they declared, and went on: 
					
					 Let all of us turn out in the just sacred war of retaliation to wipe out the Lee group of traitors in the name of five million youngsters and thus demonstrate the dignity of Kim Il Sung's nation, Kim Jong Il's Korea and the will of Songun. 
					
					 Once an order is issued, we will rush to the sacred posts of defending the country and become Ri Su Bok and Kil Yong Jo to strikingly demonstrate the power of the arms of Mt. Paektu and the strong revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu. 
					
					 We will fire all bullets and shells at our disposal for revenge and finish off bandits of traitors such as Lee Myung Bak engrossed in saber-rattling and hooliganism as corrupt and depraved gangsters. 
					
					 A resolution was adopted at the meeting. 
					
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of the youth league and youths and students in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Young Korean People Vow to Wage War of Retaliation
articles.content:
Young Korean People Vow to Wage War of Retaliation
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Upon hearing the statement of a spokesman for the Korean People's Army Supreme Command on March 2, the young Korean people vow to turn out in the sacred war of retaliation.
					Kim Chol Ung, a department director of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, told KCNA:
					
					 "We, young vanguard of Songun (military-first) era value the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK more than our own lives. 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors should be well aware of the determination of the five million young Koreans to take the lead in devotedly safeguarding the leadership of the revolution.
					
					 We will punish without mercy anyone who slanders and defames the dignity of our supreme leadership even a bit."
					
					 Kim Kwang Chol, a department director of the Pyongyang City Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, said:
					
					 "We young people will become human bullets and bombs in exterminating the Lee group of traitors.
					
					 We will wage a merciless sacred war till all acts of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK are brought to a definite end and Lee Myung Bak and military warmongers and other culprits are punished in the name of the nation.
					
					 The thrice-cursed traitors will not be able to survive the sacred war to be launched by the five million young people to devotedly defend their leader and social system."

articles.title: Resentment of Service Personnel and People at Lee Myung Bak Group Running High
articles.content:
Resentment of Service Personnel and People at Lee Myung Bak Group Runs High
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Upon hearing the statement of a spokesperson for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army, the hearts of all the servicepersons and people of the DPRK are burning with the resolution not to let those who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK even a bit go scot-free in this land and sky.
					 Kim Kum Chol, a commanding officer of the Worker-Peasant Red Guards, expressed his wrath against the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors which committed such hideous provocation as hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, not content with staging reckless military exercises during the mourning period.
					
					 He said: 
					
					 The hysteria of the puppet group has gone beyond a limit. It is intolerable. It's time to make a merciless strike at it.
					
					 The group of traitors is sadly mistaken if it thinks Inchon and Seoul are far from our bases of actions.
					
					 Once the supreme commander gives us an order, even the forces of the Worker-Peasant Red Guards are sufficient to crush the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors and blow up its stronghold. They will clearly show it how strong the power of the arms of Mt. Paektu is.
					
					 Ho Yong Ho, vice-minister of the Ministry of People's Security, expressed his firm will to make a clean sweep of human scum as follows:
					
					 Lee Myung Bak is a villain without an equal in the world and a traitor to the nation, worse than an animal.
					
					 It is a tragedy in history and shame on the nation that there is such traitor.
					
					 It is disgusting, indeed, to think that such hooliganism was masterminded by a guy who had been keen to make money while frequenting corners of the Seoul market.
					
					 We, the members of the Ministry of Peoples' Security, have turned out in the sacred war to wipe out the group of traitors to the last man so that it would never repeat such provocation as hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and decrying the dignified system in the DPRK.
					
					 Jong Chan Gyong, a department director of the Ministry of Railways, said that the workers in the field of railway transportation would transport military supplies necessary for wiping out the enemies in good time and creditably perform their duties to transport freight to different fields of the national economy in the spirit of driving their engines over the group of traitors to death.

articles.title: Korean People Vow to Destroy S. Korean Regime
articles.content:
Korean People Vow to Destroy S. Korean Regime
Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The servicepersons and civilians of the DPRK are still burning their hearts with surging indignation and strong determination to make reprisal on south Korea's Lee Myung Bak group of traitors, who defamed the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership.
					 Yun Tong Hyon, a general of the Korean People's Army, told KCNA:
					
					 "Upon hearing the news about the hideous provocation by the group of traitors, we, officers and men of the KPA three services, are anxiously waiting for an order while vowing vengeance, shouting with their towering anger 'Kill Myung Bak' and 'Knock military warmongers to death'.
					
					Our-style sacred war based on physical attack will bring all acts of hurting the dignity of our supreme leadership to a definite end and, in the name of the nation, destroy traitor Lee Myung Bak, military warmongers and other culprits of south Korea."
					
					Choe Jong Ryong, chairman of the South Hwanghae Provincial People's Committee, said:
					
					  "We, people of the DPRK, do not want war but never fear it.
					
					  All the officials and inhabitants in the province will always keep their full readiness for action, with a rifle in one hand and a hammer and sickle in the other. Once an order is given, they will turn out in the sacred war, together with the servicepersons, to reduce the enemies' headquarters into a sea of flames and achieve the national reunification without fail." 
					
					Kim Chung Gol, manager of the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex, said:
					
					 "Our workers will effect a great upsurge in steel production, with mind to throw Lee Myung Bak, Kim Kwan Jin and other traitors into a melting iron furnace."

articles.title: DPRK Citizens Enraged at S. Korean Regime's Provocation
articles.content:
DPRK Citizens Enraged at S. Korean Regime's Provocation
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- South Korea's Lee Myung Bak group's provocation to the dignity of the supreme leadership of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has pushed its citizens into fury all at once.
					 Choe Sung Muk, a war veteran residing in Rungna-dong No.1, Taedonggang District, Pyongyang, who came to Jonsung Square, told KCNA:
					
					 "Please give me a rifle to shoot to death the vilest criminal Lee Myung Bak."
					
					 The same holds true for other people, including youths, workers, peasants and intellectuals.
					
					 They will never remain onlookers at the hideous provocation, which was masterminded by traitor Lee and his lackeys Kim Kwan Jin and Jong Sung Jo at a time when the Korean people were mourning over the demise of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They are all determined to join the army in a sacred war to destroy the Lee group of traitors.

articles.title: Afforestation Drive Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Afforestation Drive Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- An afforestation drive is now progressing apace in the DPRK.
					 The Ministry of Urban Management has drawn up a plan for improving the greenbelts of streets, parks and pleasure grounds in provincial seats across the country.
					
					 Under this plan, information-sharing meeting and technical training course on afforestation are going on to raise the working ability of officials and technicians in the field of urban management. 
					
					In the capital city of Pyongyang a brisk campaign was launched to create large-scale greenbelts with various species of flowering shrubs in harmony with features of streets.  
					
					 Meanwhile, efforts have been directed to the work for putting floriculture on a scientific and intensive basis. 
					
					 The floricultural farms have introduced advanced cultivation method through multimedia. 
					
					 Seats of provinces in the country, including South and North Phyongan provinces, have planted many trees of good species suited to local climatic and soil conditions, creating greenbelts and floral beds under a blueprint. 
					
					 Tree nurseries in different parts of the country take practical measures to transplant roadside trees including zelkova and dawn redwood and shrubs.

articles.title: DPRK Phar. Dr. Kim Jong Gil
articles.content:
DPRK Phar. Dr. Kim Jong Gil
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Prof. and Dr. Kim Jong Gil, a researcher at the Koryo Medicine Research Institute of the Academy of Koryo Medicine in the DPRK, is a scholar well-known in the field of Koryo pharmacy.
					 Since he graduated from Kim Il Sung University Kim Jong Gil, 71, has worked at the medical institutes for 40 odd years. He was active at the Pharmacy Research Institute under the Academy of Medical Science before working at the Academy of Koryo Medicine.
					
					 He solved many scientific and technological problems arising in the Koryo pharmacy and authored numbers of reference books on this field, thus greatly contributing to the development of pharmacy and training of reserves.
					
					 In the period he deciphered and proved in a scientific way the ingredients of Koryo Insam (ginseng) and its pharmacological action for the first time in the country and succeeded in production of 10 odd kinds of medicines made of Koryo Insam.
					
					 He developed a new method of analyzing sugar and improved 60 kinds of Koryo medicines (Korean traditional medicine) usefully and made a research into gingko leaf extract for medicines. Among those 10 kinds of medicines he developed with gingko leaf extract are heart injection and pills for curing arteriosclerosis.
					
					 Dr. Kim won February 16 Science and Technology Prize for his distinguished contribution to the nation's development of pharmacy.

articles.title: Perpetrators of Most Hideous Provocation Will Find No Place to Hide Themselves: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Perpetrators of Most Hideous Provocation Will Find No Place to Hide Themselves: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The most wicked enemies, scum of history, perpetrated indiscreet acts towards the sun.
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors perpetrated such most hideous crimes as hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, putting all the evil doings committed by all the successive puppet forces into the shade.
					
					 The DPRK has so far served enough warnings to the group over its moves to escalate the confrontation.
					
					 But such warnings are not enough as regards what the group committed against the supreme leadership of the DPRK recently.
					
					 The whole country has been highly alerted to make a merciless retaliation against the enemies.
					
					 The servicepersons of the three services of the Korean People's Army are fully ready to rush and mercilessly take revenge upon traitor Lee Myung Bak and the puppet military warmongers with their arms.
					
					 All working people in the DPRK are bringing about great innovations and leap forward in all sectors of socialist construction, fully determined to wipe out Lee and trigger-happy elements of the south Korean puppet military to the last man.
					
					 A retaliatory sacred war has already started.
					
					 The prime-movers of the recent most hideous provocations will find no place to hide themselves: Be Inchon or Seoul or American soil or elsewhere on the earth.
					
					 It is the firm will of the DPRK to ferret out all of them even under ground and finish them off without mercy and turn the dens of mad dogs into seas in flames and their graveyards.
					
					 The DPRK's holy war will get all the more intensified nonstop till the group of traitors is forced to pay a thousand-fold dearer price for its crimes.
					
					 The KPA will wipe out to the last man those who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK even a bit and decry the dignified system in the DPRK with their fully loaded arms.
					
					 The group will never escape the retaliatory strike made by the most powerful and merciless striking means and methods beyond human imagination.
					
					 The world will witness what a miserable end the above-said criminals will meet in face of the just holy war to be waged by all the servicepersons and people of the DPRK all out in the struggle to devotedly defend their leader and system.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Refutes Japan's Claim to Tok Islets
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Refutes Japan's Claim to Tok Islets 
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- An "annual event" for dominium over Tok Islets was held in Shimane Prefecture, Japan on Feb. 22.
					 At the event attended by Dietmen, "testimonials" were awarded to those who allegedly provided data on Tok islets.
					
					 And such reckless remarks that "A state devoid of territorial consciousness has no reason to exist" were openly made there.
					
					 This is a wanton infringement on the Korean nation's territorial sovereignty and a serious crime.
					
					 Tok Islets are part of the inviolable territory of Korea from the historical, geographical and legal points of view.
					
					 This was clearly proved through old maps worked out in Japan and the decision of the Japan shogunate dated January of 1696 in which it recognized the dominium of Korea over the Ullung Island and Tok Islets. 
					
					 However, the Japanese reactionaries, disregarding these historical facts, have recently tried to set the "Takeshima Day" as an all-Japan "memorial" day. They are even mulling creating a department exclusively dealing with issues related to Tok Islets.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' territorial claim to the islets is to convince its people that Tok Islets belong to Japan, get them ready for war of territorial expansion. This is also aimed to internationally justify their move to seize Tok Islets.
					
					 Japan's ulterior objective is to plunder the islets of their abundant underground and marine resources and to furthermore realize their ambition of reinvading Korea with the islets as a springboard.
					
					 It is the trite way employed by Japan to stoke territorial disputes and provoke a war of aggression under that pretext.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will never remain an on-looker to the Japanese reactionaries' reckless claim to Tok islets and their moves to secure justifications for reinvading Korea. 
					
					 Neither compromise nor concession can be allowed as for territorial issue.
					
					 Japan's ambition to grab Tok Islets will never come true.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Single-minded Unity
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Single-minded Unity 
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors will have to pay a dear price for every reckless act against the DPRK just as the history of the single-minded unity of the DPRK has proved it in reality. 
					Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 This is because the DPRK is an invincible power having tremendous might of unbreakable single-minded unity the core of which is the spirit of devotedly protecting the leader, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The DPRK is the only country which achieved the single-minded unity rare to be seen in any other part of the world.
					
					 The single-minded unity of the leader, the party and people is a source of inexhaustible strength of the socialist system in the DPRK.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK are single-mindedly united close around the party and leader with the unshakable faith to defend their country and socialist system with their lives and honorably safeguard the dignity and sovereignty of the country and nation. This is the main factor of their capacity to resolutely smash every reckless move of the enemies.
					
					 The single-minded unity of the DPRK admired by the world is the most powerful and solid as it is based on the monolithic idea and unity of actions.
					
					 The Songun politics is invincible as it helped the Korean People's Army equip itself with the Juche-oriented war strategy and tactics and the state-of-the-art means for offensive and defence and the spirit of becoming human bullets and bombs, the spirit of devotedly defending the leader, system and people.
					
					A war has not yet broken out on the Korean Peninsula thanks to the above-said unity more powerful than nuclear weapons and the defence capability for self-defence bolstered up by dint of Songun.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Defense Minister's Outbursts
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Defense Minister's Outbursts 
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- South Korean Minister of Defense Kim Kwan Jin let loose a spate of reckless remarks hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. He asserted that  "there is the possibility of the north's provocation" while inspecting different units under the pretext of examining "defense posture" on Feb. 27, the first day of the joint military exercises to invade the north. Earlier, he appeared at the command and control room of the puppet joint chiefs of staff on the day when the live shell firing exercise kicked off in the areas of Paekryong and Yonphyong Islands and ordered to "promptly react to whatever provocation" from someone.
					 Rodong Sinmun on Monday says in a by-lined commentary in this regard: What this vicious warmonger recklessly blustered, blinded with the wild ambition for invading the north, is the height of political and military provocation.
					
					 His grumbling about "provocation" from someone itself is an unpardonable provocation to the DPRK, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 As far as traitor Kim Kwan Jin is concerned, he has been more frantic than anybody else in the confrontation with fellow countrymen, taking the lead in carrying out the south Korean conservative authorities' policy of war of aggression against the north. No sooner had he assumed the post of minister of Defense than let loose such provocative outbursts as "stern punishment" and "retaliation," escalating the north-south confrontation and desperately fanning up war fever. In the wake of the Yonphyong island shelling incident, he issued a dangerous skirmish instruction called "take action first and report later," giving the officers of the puppet army on the forefront the right to fire as they please. 
					
					 Hoodlums of the puppet army set up target boards bearing slogans hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and its system and fired bullets and shells at them. Not content with this, they carelessly hung the portraits of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu on the walls and gates of buildings and scrawled unspeakable defamatory words below them. It was none other than Kim Kwan Jin who masterminded this thrice-cursed hooliganism.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK are taking strict tabs not only on the military provocations perpetrated by him, seized with extreme bitterness towards compatriots, but also the recent most hideous provocation committed by him against the nation. They will chase him to the last no matter where he goes in hiding and mercilessly punish him.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Crackdown on Progressive Reform Forces Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Crackdown on Progressive Reform Forces Slammed
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities recently sentenced to heavy penalties those related to the "Wangjaesan case" after rounding off investigation into it. They have dragged on the case since last year. They arrested Ri Chang Gi, publisher of Jaju Minbo, charging that he carried an article supporting the Songun politics of the DPRK in violation of the "Security Law". 
					 Minju Joson Monday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is a sign of possible massive suppression of the progressive reform forces. 
					
					 The "Wangjaesan incident" was a fabrication cooked up by the puppet authorities. 
					
					 In July last year, the puppet security authorities announced that they uncovered a "spy ring" which set up an anti-state organization at the instructions of the "north" and has been operational for years centering on the Inchon area. 
					
					 In the subsequent period, they arrested many people smearing them as "spies", but failed to present any evidence proving their connection with the north. So, the south Korean court, too, had no choice but to declare them non-guilty as for the charges of the "formation and accession to the anti-state organization" brought against them.
					
					 The same is the case with the crackdown on Ri Chang Gi.
					
					 That Ri Chang Gi carried articles supporting the Songun politics in Jaju Minbo deserves appraisal and promotion as it reflected the south Korean people's sentiment.
					
					 It has become the global trend to praise and learn from the Songun politics of the DPRK which resolutely foil the imperialists' moves and firmly defend the dignity and sovereignty of the nation.
					
					 Organizations studying and introducing the Songun politics are openly operational in the U.S. which the puppet forces serve as their master.
					
					 Problem is the crackdown upon the progressive reform forces which is escalating ahead of the "parliamentary" election in April.
					
					 This will result in disclosing the nature of traitors as escalator of confrontation with compatriots and hastening their destruction.

articles.title: Sortie Drill for Preemptive Strike at North Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Sortie Drill for Preemptive Strike at North Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Air forces of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and the south Korean puppet army conducted a sortie drill for a preemptive strike at the DPRK in the U.S. air force base in Kunsan on March 4, according to south Korean CBS.
					 That day at least 60 fighters armed with various type missiles and other weaponry were busy with a group drill for making sorties in the shortest possible time.
					
					 It was for the first time that the puppet air force participated in the drill which had been conducted by the 8th combat flying corps of the U.S. Air Force single-handed till last year, said the report. 
					
					 The puppet warmongers who committed the most hideous criminal act of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK are getting more frantic with the moves for a war against the north at the prodding of the U.S. imperialists despite denunciation at home and abroad.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Provocation under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Provocation under Fire
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Hideous provocation, committed by south Korea's Lee Myung Bak group of traitors against the dignity of the supreme leadership of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, has continued to be under fire by local people.
					 Prof. and Dr. Jo Hui Sung at the History Institute under the Academy of Social Sciences told KCNA:
					
					 "Traitor Lee Myung Bak tops the list of successive south Korean rulers in making confrontation against the DPRK. Lee and his lackeys Kim Kwan Jin and Jong Sung Jo had masterminded such campaigns as firing at the target featuring the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership and setting up slogans slandering the DPRK dignity and social system in frontline units of their army. History will settle accounts with them as traitors to the nation."
					
					 An officer of the Korean People's Army, Kim Chol Bong, said:
					
					 "The present situation urges us to destroy the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors by force of arms. If they are left intact, the entire Korean nation would suffer a big misfortune. There will be no shelter on the earth for them running amuck like a puppy knowing no fear of a tiger."

articles.title: Participants in Int'l Railways Meeting Much Impressed to Watch Grand Art Performance
articles.content:
Participants in Int'l Railways Meeting Much Impressed to Watch Grand Art Performance
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Members of foreign delegations who participated in the international railways meeting of Asian countries of the Organization of Railways Cooperation were deeply impressed to watch a grand performance "We Will Be Loyal Down through Generations" commemorating General Secretary Kim Jong Il's birth anniversary (the Day of Shining Star). The meeting was held to agree upon foreign trade freight transport volume for 2012
					 The head of the Chinese delegation said:
					
					 The performance impressed me very much. It was of high ideological and artistic value and its numbers were unique and peculiar.
					
					 The performance impressively showed the determination of the Korean people to dynamically advance, rallied close around the dear respected Kim Jong Un, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A member of the Vietnamese delegation said he was deeply impressed to watch the performance, adding: While watching it, I keenly felt how deeply the Korean people revere their leader. The performers made a successful ideological and artistic representation of their faith and will to hold their leader in high esteem forever. Such performance can be watched in the DPRK only.
					
					 A member of the Kazakh delegation had this to say:
					
					 I have never watched such large-scale performance before.
					
					 Each number reflects the feelings of the Korean people missing Kim Jong Il very much. I feel I have seen true arts today.
					
					 Mikhail Ivanov, a member of the Russian delegation, said: Everything was perfect. The performance represented the true feelings of the Korean people. I was deeply moved to see the audience sobbing, looking up to the image of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Andrei Chirkov, a member of the Russian delegation, stressed:
					
					 I was admired by the boundless reverence of the Korean people for their leader. I believe the Korean revolution is sure to triumph under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un as it was pioneered by President Kim Il Sung and led by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Key Resolve, Foal Eagle under Fire by French Organization
articles.content:
Key Resolve, Foal Eagle under Fire by French Organization
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The France-Korea Friendship Association issued a statement on Feb. 26 condemning the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers for staging Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises.
					 Recalling that the ongoing saber-rattling is again escalating the tension on the Korean Peninsula, the statement went on:
					
					 The U.S. and south Korea claim the above-said war maneuvers are "annual ones for defense" but they are war drills simulating aggression against the DPRK in view of the scope of the forces and military hardware involved. 
					
					 The joint military exercises have created such tense situation on the Korean Peninsula that a war may break out any moment.
					
					 The statement of a spokesman for the National Defence Commission of the DPRK warned that the army and people of the DPRK will foil the moves of the group of traitors to the nation and warmongers at home and abroad for a new war with a sacred war of their own style and they will always keep the bases of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and centers for their military operations against the DPRK within striking range and wipe them out at a single blow, should they provoke it.
					
					 The France-Korea Friendship Association bitterly denounces the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises straining the situation on the peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Observed in Over 100 Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Observed in Over 100 Countries
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- An Internet international seminar on the theme of "The great General Secretary Kim Jong Il will always be with us" took place on December 24 last year to commemorate the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, the Day of the Shining Day, and this event was followed by diverse events held with splendor in more than 100 countries.
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un received messages from presidents of Russia, Syria, Myanmar, Uganda, Democratic Congo and Guinea, the chairman of the Mongolian People's Party, the general chairwoman of the Central Directive Council of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, the coordinator (leader) of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico and other heads of states and parties in different countries.
					
					 Statements were released by organizations of Mongolia, Indonesia and Britain and many personages including the president of the Bangladesh People's League, the general secretary of the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy, the chairman of the Arab Socialist Party of Egypt, the general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Vanguard of Costa Rica, the secretary general of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea and the director-general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 Floral baskets and bouquets were sent to the DPRK missions in different countries to pray for the immortality of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They were sent by political parties, government ministries, organizations and organs in different countries including China, Cuba, Vietnam, Laos, Myanmar, Cambodia, Switzerland, Sweden, Italy, the Czech Republic and the U.S. and international and regional organizations and famous personages of political and public circles.
					
					 Many personages visited the DPRK missions to lay floral baskets before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and full-length pictures of the peerlessly great men standing together and paid highest tribute to them.
					
					 Gifts were presented to Kim Jong Il praying for his immortality by different foreign organizations and personages. They included the State Academic Igor Moiseyev Dance Company of Russia, the Brazilian Centre for Peace and Solidarity with Peoples and the Al Bayan National Trading Company of Kuwait and Kuwaiti and Vietnamese personages.
					
					 Kim Jong Il was awarded a prize and honorary titles by organizations and cities in different countries. The Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Politics conferred the Nepalese International Peace Prize on him and the Soekarno Foundation for Education of Indonesia the title of its honorary chairman. Titles of honorary citizenship were awarded to him by Gusau City, Zamfara State, and Damaturu City, Yobe State, Nigeria, and Caluma City, Bolivar Province, Ecuador.
					
					 Kimjongilia shows were held with splendor in Dalian, China, and Nakhodka and Vladivostok, Russia.
					
					 Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibitions opened in Ulan-Ude, capital of Buryatiya, Russia, and many countries including China, Malaysia, Bulgaria, Guinea, Congo, Uganda, Ecuador, Brazil and Dominican Republic and by the Women's International Democratic Federation.
					
					 Works of the peerlessly great man were published in pamphlet by various units including the Victorial Publishing House of Pakistan, the Group of Dialectical Materialists of Italy and the Publishing House of the Workers' Party of Mexico. Media of various countries carried full texts or gists of their works.
					
					 The short biography of Kim Jong Il was widely introduced in Russia, Nepal, Syria, Kuwait, Democratic Congo, Bulgaria, Peru and Brazil.
					
					 Media of various countries gave wide publicity to events held to commemorate the Day of the Shining Star.
					
					 Political parties and organizations in different countries and international and regional organizations released bulletins or posted articles on their Internet homepages under "Son of Mt. Paektu", "February 16, 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il" and "Leader Kim Jong Il will always be alive" and other titles.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet Homepage of Swiss Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet Homepage of Swiss Organization
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on its Internet homepage on Feb. 23 the full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let the North and the South Open the Way to Peace and the Reunification of the Country in a United Effort".
					 The work, published on Feb. 20, Juche 81 (1992), says that the effectuation of the "Agreement on Reconciliation, Nonaggression, and Cooperation and Exchange between North and South" and the "Joint Declaration on the Denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula" is an epoch-making event in achieving peace and the reunification of the country. It also indicates the way of pushing forward the struggle for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: China Rebukes Japan for Naming Diaoyu Island Its Own Way
articles.content:
China Rebukes Japan for Naming Diaoyu Island Its Own Way
 Beijing, March 4 (KCNA) -- Hong Lei, spokesperson for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of China, at a press conference on Saturday rebuked Japan for naming the Diaoyu Island its own way.
					 The Japanese authorities made public the names of the Diaoyu Island and its surrounding islets which they made their own way on March 2, Hong said, expressing strong opposition to it.
					
					 It is illegal and invalid for the Japanese side to take unilateral measures on the Diaoyu Island and its surrounding islets, Hong stressed.

articles.title: Cuba Assails Double Standards on Human Rights Issue
articles.content:
Cuba Assails Double Standards on Human Rights Issue
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- The deputy foreign minister of Cuba accused the United States and other Western powers of their ideological manipulation, political hypocrisy and double standards on human rights issue.
					 Speaking at the 19th session of the UN Human Rights Council on Thursday, he said human rights are not the real motivation of those who have promoted biased special sessions, selective resolutions, setting special rapporteurs on countries and other specific forms against the Southern nations.
					
					 The objectives of those powers are to ensure large reserves of oil and water and confiscate financial assets in times of social or economic crisis, he denounced.

articles.title: Indonesia Calls for Acknowledging Palestine's Independence
articles.content:
Indonesia Calls for Acknowledging Palestine's Independence
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Indonesia keeps encouraging countries to acknowledge Palestine's independence, said a spokesman of the Foreign Ministry at a press briefing on March 2.
					 He said Indonesia is also exploring to open a diplomatic mission in Palestine.
					
					 "Palestine's independence is one of our priorities. In Non- Alignment Movement (NAM) summit in Bali last year, we raised the issue. Indonesia also has drafted a roadmap for the NAM to support Palestine. We keep encouraging countries that have not yet acknowledged Palestine's independence to do that," he said.
					
					 He added that Indonesia has been providing helps of capacity building to Palestine and coordinate concrete helps from countries who share the same concern.

articles.title: Top Banks Protest U.S. Resolution against Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Top Banks Protest U.S. Resolution against Sri Lanka
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Top commercial banks in Sri Lanka have joined protests against a U.S.-backed resolution to investigate alleged war crimes in a unique move, an industry body said in a statement Thursday.
					 Leading commercial and specialized banks via the industry body Sri Lanka Banks' Association has joined the majority Sri Lankans who are opposing moves by UN Human Rights Council (UNHRC) to pass a resolution against the country.
					
					 In a statement, the bank association said its members were highly disturbed by the attempts made by some countries to pass a resolution against Sri Lanka and interfere with the progress that has been and is being made by the government of Sri Lanka in achieving ethnic harmony and reconciliation among all communities.
					
					"We believe that such interference would bring in new tensions and disrupt the process which has already begun," the association said, adding that reconciliation should be achieved by home grown policies.
					
					Sri Lanka is campaigning heavily to defeat a move by the U.S. to initiate an international investigation into alleged war crimes, which is to be presented to the UNHRC on Thursday.

articles.title: Sudan Criticizes ICC Arrest Warrant against Its Defense Minister
articles.content:
Sudan Criticizes ICC Arrest Warrant against Its Defense Minister
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Sudan on Thursday criticized decision by International Criminal Court (ICC) issuing an arrest warrant against Sudanese Minister of Defense Abdel-Rahim Mohamed Hussein for war crimes allegedly committed in Sudan's Darfur, official SUNA news agency reported.
					 "Sudan considers the ICC a political tool and not a judiciary entity that seeks to achieve what is for the interest of humanity," the agency quoted Sana Hamad, Sudan's State Minister for Information, as saying. "Since the issuance of the alleged indictment by (Luis Moreno) Ocampo last December against the minister of defense, the issuance of the arrest warrant was expected," she added.
					
					 She went on saying that Sudan was adherent to its previously declared stance, like all non-signatory countries to the ICC statute, which is that the ICC has no jurisdiction in Sudan and therefore Sudan is not concerned with its decisions.

articles.title: Cooperation among Several Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Several Countries
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Russia and Guatemala on Wednesday put into force the agreement on "no visas requirements", a step in the development of their relations.
					 Russia Supreme Court President Viacheslav M. Lebedev and his Cuban counterpart Ruben Remigio signed on Feb. 27 a protocol paving the way for regular consultation and communication to promote judicial cooperation and exchange on legal know-how and staff.

articles.title: Turkey Opposes Military Intervention in Iran
articles.content:
Turkey Opposes Military Intervention in Iran
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- Turkey's Deputy Prime Minister Ali Babacan on Friday expressed opposition to any military intervention aimed at forcing Iran to halt its controversial nuclear program.
					"The problem over Iran's nuclear issue has to be resolved through diplomacy. Methods other than that would have grave consequences for the region and even for the world," Babacan said during the Aspen Bosphorus Dialogue conference.
					
					"Otherwise no one will gain from this confrontation", he added.

articles.title: British FM Calls for Closing Guantanamo Bay
articles.content:
British FM Calls for Closing Guantanamo Bay
 Pyongyang, March 5 (KCNA) -- British Foreign Secretary William Hague on Thursday urged the United States to close its military detention center at Guantanamo Bay in Cuba and release a British detainee.
					 "The UK believes that indefinite detention in Guantanamo Bay is    wrong and will continue to call for Guantanamo Bay to be closed and Mr. Aamer to be returned to his family in the UK," Hague said after  a meeting.

articles.title: Acto de decision de jovenes y estudiantes para alistarse a EPC
articles.content:
Acto de decision de jovenes y estudiantes para alistarse a EPC
Pyongyang, 5 de marzo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar este lunes en la explanada frente a la estatua de "Victoria", tema fundamental del Monumento a la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, el acto de determinacion de jovenes y estudiantes de alistarse o retornarse al servicio militar para tomar parte en la sagrada guerra a estilo coreano contra la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak que difamo nuestra maxima dignidad.
					Se distinguian en la sede de acto las consignas y pancartas como "!Defendamos a vida o muerte al Comite Central del Partido encabezado por el querido camarada Kim Jong Un!", "!Despedacemos a Lee Myung Bak en nombre de la nacion!" y "!Propinemos el fuego de represalia mediante la guerra sagrada a nuestro estilo de todos los militares y civiles!"
					
					Ri Yong Chol, primer secretario del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Socialista      Kim Il Sung, dio lectura a la declaracion del portavoz de la Comandancia Suprema del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					Hicieron uso de la palabra Ri Jo Il, primer secretario de la misma organizacion juvenil en la ciudad de Songrim, Jong Tu Song, estudiante de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, Ri Myong Won, obrero de la Fabrica de Alimentos Taedonggang y Pae Song Nam. alumno de la Escuela Secundaria Rakwon de Pyongyang,.
					
					Los oradores aseveraron que todo el pueblo no contiene su indignacion furiosa ante el hecho de que los deformadores mentales insultaron nuestra maxima dignidad mas preciosa que su vida.
					
					Se refirieron a que los jovenes y estudiantes de todo el pais solicitan alistarse o retornarse al EPC con el impetu de aniquilar por completo a los enemigos jurados y escorias humanas y convertir en cenizas la madriguera de los traidores con el golpe demoledor del Songun.
					
					Con el honor de 5 millones de vanguardias juveniles armadas con la dignidad de la nacion de Kim Il Sung y la Corea de Kim Jong Il y la voluntad del Songun, debemos tomar parte en la justa y sagrada guerra para extirpar de raiz en  este territorio patrio a la banda de los traidores surcoreanos.
					
					Una vez dada la orden, demostraremos en los sagrados puestos de defensa de la patria el coraje y el poder real del ejercito revolucionario del monte Paektu como lo hicieron los heroes Ri Su Bok y Kil Yong Jo.
					
					Daremos punto final al destino de Lee y sus seguidores que se dedican a tales difamaciones lanzandoles despiadadamente las balas y proyectiles de venganza.
					
					En el acto quedo aprobada una resolucion.
					
					Estuvieron presentes Choe Ryong Hae, secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, los funcionarios de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, jovenes y estudiantes en esta capital.

articles.title: ACNC denuncia insistencia de Japon en derecho a posesion de islote Tok
articles.content:
ACNC denuncia insistencia de Japon en derecho a posesion de islote Tok
Pyongyang, 5 de marzo (ACNC) -- El 22 de febrero pasado, tuvo lugar en el departamento de Shimane, Japon, un "acto anual" insistiendo en el derecho a posesion del islote Tok. 
					En la ocasion participaron colectivamente los parlamentarios y fue otorgado un "agradecimiento escrito" a quienes ofrecieron los datos sobre dicho islote. 
					
					Algunos dijeron abiertamente que "no existira un Estado carente de la conciencia del territorio". 
					
					Esto es un crimen intolerable y grave violacion a la soberania territorial de la nacion coreana. 
					
					Desde el punto de vista historico, geografico y juridico el islote Tok pertenece a una parte del sagrado territorio coreano. 
					
					  Lo comprueban los mapas antiguos emitidos por Japon y la resolucion del gobierno japones aprobada en enero de 1696 en que reconocio la posesion de Corea de la isla Ullung y el islote Tok. 
					
					  Sin embargo, los reaccionarios japoneses dan espaldas a este hecho historico y pretenden instituir el "dia de Takeshima" como "dia conmemorativo nacional". 
					
					  El gobierno tambien intenta organizar una seccion especializada encargada del islote Tok. 
					
					  La insistencia de los reaccionarios japoneses en el derecho a posesion del islote Tok parte de la intencion de preparar a la poblacion japonesa para la guerra de expansion territorial, justificar en la arena internacional sus maniobras de usurpacion de ese territorio coreano, saquear inagotables recursos naturales y pesqueros y, a la larga, adquirir pretexto de nueva agresion a Corea. 
					
					Provocar un conflicto territorial y desatar una guerra de agresion tomandolo por pretexto es el metodo rutinario de Japon. 
					
					El ejercito y pueblo coreanos no estaran con los brazos cruzados ante tales maniobras imprudentes de los reaccionarios japoneses. 
					
					En el tema del territorio, no habra ninguna conciliacion ni concesion. 
					
					Nunca sera realizada la ambicion de Japon de usurpar el islote Tok.
